content:
Enable Moderation for Social Customer Service

Use moderation to triage incoming posts and only create cases for posts that are actionable requests for help. Moderation helps your organization focus on real customer issues and avoid opening unnecessary cases.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS
Social Customer Service is available in Salesforce Classic and Lightning Experience. Service Setup is available in Lightning Experience.
Social Customer Service is available in all editions with the Service Cloud.

USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To administer Social Customer Service:	
Manage Users

AND

Customize Application

To enable moderation for social customer service:

From your Social Studio Automate account, click the Rules tab.
Create a rule to indicate that no case is created in Salesforce.
Action: send to Salesforce. Create Case checkbox unchecked.

Case creation can also be customized by implementing a custom Apex case logic.

To manually update your custom Apex class, add the following code and update your moderation social post list view.

Call this method directly before inserting the post, after all the relationships have been set on the post.
private void setModeration(SocialPost post){
    //if we don't automatically create a case, we should flag the post as requiring moderator review.
    if(post.parentId == null)
        post.reviewedStatus = 'Needed';
}

In the default Apex, see lines 50 and 61-65.

Update your moderation social post list filter from:
Parent EQUAL TO "" AND ReviewStatus NOT EQUAL TO "ignore"

To:

Parent EQUAL TO "" AND ReviewStatus EQUAL TO "Needed"
title: Enabling Moderation for Social Customer Service in Salesforce
